hero.title:
Spin up a proxy cluster in one click,
connect your own devices within seconds.
hero.description: Aggregate global endpoints to build a governed, scalable proxy IP pool.

cards.title: Real-time monitoring
cards.description: Unified control center surfaces device status and usage instantly.

cards.title: High performance
cards.description: Async NIO and memory reuse sustain 200 Mbps per host in validation.

cards.title: Multi-endpoint coverage
cards.description: Windows, Linux, macOS, Android, and router environments are supported out of the box.

items.title: Simple operations
items.description: Host mode boots the service, auto-registers nodes, and opens tunnels to minimize deployment friction.

items.title: Rich endpoint options
items.description: Support for PCs, servers, Android, routers, plus APIs for integrating into business systems.

items.title: Management & control
items.description: Multi-tenant accounts, reports, device monitoring, remote replay and control, with metering across supply and consumption.

items.title: Reliability & performance
items.description: Compatible with HTTP / HTTPS / SOCKS5, delivers millisecond failover, and scales proxy traffic with high throughput.

steps.title: Deploy in one command
summary: Prepare a Linux host with public network access and Docker installed.
Pull the majora3 all-in-one image from the official registry.
Run in host mode and mount a persistent data directory.
Sign in to the console: the first registered user becomes the admin account, demo credentials remain available.
steps.code:
yum install -y docker
docker pull registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/iinti/majora3:all-in-one
docker run -d --network host \
  -v ~/majora3-mysql-data:/var/lib/mysql \
  --name majora3 \
  registry.cn-beijing.aliyuncs.com/iinti/majora3:all-in-one
echo "Open http://127.0.0.1:6879 and login with majora/majora"
echo "The first registered user becomes the admin account"

items.title: VPS nodes
items.description: One-command Linux client covers servers and cloud hosts, supporting batch deployment and scripted operations.

items.title: Router terminals
items.description: OpenWrt and other routers join quickly, bringing home or office broadband into the proxy pool.

items.title: Android 4G devices
items.description: Android client runs reliably on phones or SBCs to expose stable 4G proxy traffic.

pricing.title: Commercial licensing pricing
pricing.intro: Licensing is counted per server IP. Each server costs RMB 1,000 per month (quarterly billing or longer). Free updates and upgrade support are included during the licensing period.
pricing.note: Need source code licensing or custom services? Contact our sales team for a tailored quotation.

concepts.title: Core capabilities overview
concepts.intro: Understand how Majora3 helps you build a controlled, scalable proxy IP pool across four pillars.

items.title: IP pool models
items.description: Random, Static, Consistent, and City strategies balance stability, location coverage, and dynamic routing.

items.title: Endpoint onboarding
items.description: Unified governance for Linux, Windows, macOS, routers, and Android with built-in NAT traversal.

items.title: Rebinding mechanism
items.description: Refresh egress IPs through redial or flight-mode actions, with fine-grained control over scope and cadence.

items.title: Security & performance
items.description: Dual-account governance, ACL auditing, event-driven architecture, and full-stack monitoring for stable 200 Mbps forwarding.
